repository.corpname: University of Montana, Mansfield Library, Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: This collection contains Red Lodge Canning Company correspondence, financial, legal, organizational, promotional, photographic records as well as documents from the Rocky Mountain Distributing Company, a beer distribution division of the larger company.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: In 1926, a group of investors organized the Red Lodge Canning Company in Red Lodge, Montana, and hired M.H. Mann as the manager. He became president of the company, and later the largest stockholder. His son, Blaine W. Mann, took over management of the company after M.H. retired.

The company operated canneries in Red Lodge and in Stevensville, Montana. Products canned included corn, peas, and beans from the Red Lodge and Stevensville, Montana areas. The company operated a beer distribution division, sometimes identified as Rocky Mountain Distributing Company, from 1950 to 1958. This division held distribution contracts with several brewing companies, local and national, for Carbon and Stillwater counties in Montana.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains Red Lodge Canning Company correspondence, financial, legal, organizational, promotional, photographic records as well as documents from the Rocky Mountain Distributing Company, a beer distribution division of the larger company. Aside from three folders of internal correspondence with the Stevensville operation and an extensive photographic sequence, all materials in this collection address the Red Lodge and Stevensville operations as one unit. The materials in this collection provide insights into Montana's rural canning industry, the extent of horticultural production in the state, horticultural product transportation/distribution networks, and the development of local food distribution economies through much of the 20th Century.

arrangement.p: The collection is divided ito seven series:
Series V: Printed Materials, 1922-1943, 0.75 linear feet
Series VII: Beer Distributorship, 1950-1958, 2.25 linear feet

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must use collection in accordance with the policies of Archives and Special Collections, the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, and the University of Montana-Missoula.

userestrict.p: Researchers are responsible for using in accordance with 17 U.S.C. and any other applicable statutes. Copyright not transferred to the University of Montana.

prefercite.p: [Name of document or photograph number], Red Lodge Canning Company Records, Archives and Special Collections, The University of Montana-Missoula.

custodhist.p: Blaine Mann originally gave the records to the Montana Historical Society.

acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Montana Historical Society, 1976.

processinfo.p: The actions of the original processors are unknown. In 2004, the collection was re-described; the original order of the collection was unchanged.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence records from the Red Lodge Canning Company. Series materials are divided into two subseries, general and interoffice. The general correspondence subseries includes incoming and outgoing materials from company officials, primarily E.H. and Blaine Mann, to vegetable growers, canning suppliers, public officials, and distributors. These materials include exchanges with nearly every Montana Congressional representative during the time period, primarily concerning industry issues and company requests for special action. The interoffice subseries contains procedural memos and exchanges regarding leadership decisions.

scopecontent.p: This series contains production statements, account records, and asset statements from the Red Lodge Canning Company.

did.unittitle: Payroll 1926-1927; Raw Materials Purchased 1926; Check Register, 1937-1957

scopecontent.p: This series contains purchase agreements, operational licenses, equipment lease agreements, and distribution contracts from the Red Lodge Canning Company.
This series contains stockholder information and board minutes from the Red Lodge Canning Company.

This series contains canning industry publications, Red Lodge Canning Company sample labels, and company promotional materials. This series also contains a folder of numerous birth certificates from Butte and Red Lodge, Montana (dating from 1922-1926).

This series contains 37 images of Red Lodge Canning Company facilities and company-related events in Red Lodge, Montana as well as 36 images of company operations in Stevensville, Montana. These images include photographs of the 1972 Red Lodge Sweet Pea Parade, pea processing techniques, corn processing and cattle drives in the Bitterroot Valley, and a company-sponsored bowling team in Red Lodge.

scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence and account statements for the Red Lodge Canning Company's beer distribution division, sometimes identified as the Rocky Mountain Distributing Company. This operation held beer distribution contracts with several brewing companies, local and national, for Carbon and Stillwater counties in Montana.
